name: Salman Sharif
about: Hello and welcome to my website! My name is Salman and I was informally known as the “Bug Master” at my previous company, Flipp because not only was I great at finding issues within the software, I addressed these issues to the best of my ability as well. When joining a new organization or team, I seek opportunities for growth and facilitate inclusivity especially as the organization evolves. I have completed my Bachelor of Science degree specializing in Computer Science and Software Engineering from the University of Toronto Scarborough and I’m looking forward to applying what I have learned throughout my career. Feel free to contact me using the contact information listed above

educations.degree: Honours Bachelors of Science in Computer Science (Sotware Engineering)

description: Automated Mobile Banking Manual test cases for release validation using Appium Scripts written in Java in order to decrease time to production from 2 weeks to 2 days.
Developed test cases for new features introduced by developer and design teams using ALM and Design Documentation improving release and subsequent regression cycles.
Onboarded new team members for the Automation team by creating documents for setup/walkthroughs of automation tools on new machines using Confluence pages decreasing onboarding time by 4X.

Created scripts for automating the development of tasks using Python, Testrail API, Jenkins, and CircleCI to increase speed between code cut-off and release of app and reduce time to market of new features by 50%.

Transitioned app from processing data on the app to the server by testing updated codebase to improve the performance of the app by at least 2X using Java, Android Studio, Testrail API, Swit, and Xcode.
Identified 100+ issues within the iOS and Android Flipp app using documentation and requirement lists to improve the quality of the app, achieving nomination of “Bug Master” within the organization.
Created automated tools and test cases to simplify manual testing by 3X using HP Unified Functional Testing and Selenium in order to assess multiple applications in the most efficient way.

Upgraded performance tested multiple applications from Oracle 11g to 12c DB, resulting in improvement in performance of sotware from 30s response time to under 10s (3X increase) and improved clients satisfaction.

volunteer-exp.company: Department of Student Life at University of Toronto Scarborough

projects.name: New Personal Portfolio
projects.desc: Updated personal webpage to broadcast my brand as a sotware engineer
other: Developed portfolio website using JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap, deployed through Github pages, and Namecheap to demonstrate personal accomplishments.
Secured app using HTTPS and other security practices to create trustworthy brands for potential employers.

other: Developed portfolio website using JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap, deployed through Github pages, and Namecheap to demonstrate personal accomplishments.
Secured app using HTTPS and other security practices to create trustworthy brands for potential employers.

projects.name: SMAA app
projects.desc: E-commerce Web App for SMAA Corp
other: Created multiple interactive web pages and views using Vue.js and Vuetify to attract online customers and increase company revenue by 50%.
Implemented Login/Registration and route guarding using Firebase and node.js to allow valid customers to order products from our company and increase sales by 50%.

projects.name: Personal Portfolio V1
projects.desc: Personal webpage to broadcast my brand as a sotware engineer
other: Developed portfolio website using JavaScript, HTML5, CSS3, and Bootstrap, deployed through Github pages, and Namecheap to demonstrate personal accomplishments.
Secured app using HTTPS and other security practices to create trustworthy brands for potential employers.

projects.name: Book a Room
projects.desc: Centralized platform where individuals looking for temporary open office can book a room
other: Created room renting application using JavaScript, React, Node.js, Express, and MongoDB with Google Search and Maps API integration to enable office workers to easily book temporary rooms.
Deployed project using Heroku and Let's Encrypt in order to get HTTPS certified application and handle users data safely to mitigate breach impacts.

projects.name: Robot Soccer
projects.desc: Lego Mastercraft Robot programmed to play soccer on its own at UTSC Embeded systems final competition
other: Created and coded up a Lego robot to play soccer against other Lego robots and achieved placing top 5 in the competition.
Utilized webcam input along with Lego Mindstorms API to create an adaptive program that can maneuver a tennis ball to the goal in order to move ahead of the competition.

projects.name: UTSC Study Buddies App
projects.desc: Study-group app for UTSC sustainability maker challenge
other: Tackled the Quality of Education issue by designing an app that helps find study partners more conveniently.
Surveyed students on their interest for the idea in order to estimate the amount of users interested in the app.
Demonstrated a working prototype of the plan to the judges by building an IOS application in order to achieve the most feasible prize.

projects.name: InCase
other: Created an iOS app in 36 hours that resulted in securing the “Best use of Microsoft Azure” and placing top 10 in the competition.
Implemented a Voice to Text feature by through internet research for 9 hours and deploying it into the app to create a proof of concept of the project meeting a requirement for its vision.

projects.name: Tron Game
other: Worked with a group of 3 members in order to design and create a working game using a FPGA board, VGA monitor, and 2 breadboards.
Created modules in Verilog to implement logic to the game in order to build the project using hardware knowledge.
Designed and implemented 2 game controller circuits in order to interact with the game using custom input devices.

projects.name: Flight Manager App
other: Actively worked in a group of 3 members in order to complete tasks efficiently in order to produce a working application under a month.
Implemented a sorting and searching algorithm by using the Java API in order to identify the best and cheapest route from one city to another for the user.
Designed a Unified Modeling Language Diagram to plan out the execution of the app in order to assign important tasks to each member.
